intro: Kyllinga dentata, commonly known as the toothed spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow and slightly toothed, giving it its common name. Kyllinga dentata produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spiky inflorescences.
